eligibility:
Lateral Entry:
Candidates who have successfully completed the 3 years diploma in Engineering are eligible to apply for lateral entry into engineering programmes.
why_choose: Why choose this course? Excellent Infrastructure and domain expert faculty members Focus on Core CSE and IOT specialization Honors courses on AI & ML, Data Analytics and Cyber Security Opportunity for real time futuristic projects Industry Tie-ups and Research Opportunities Abroad University exchange programs
what_learn: What you will learn? Students will learn the basic principles and concepts of the Internet of Things, including its history, evolution, and the significance of IoT in various industries. Leveraging data generated by IoT devices to derive meaningful insights, predictive analytics, and Artificial Intelligence for decision-making. Designing and implementing IoT based solutions with cloud backbone. Exploring IoT applications in various industries, such as healthcare, agriculture, smart cities, transportation, and industrial automation. Hands-on experience with hardware and software tools for building IoT prototypes and solutions. Learning to plan, execute, and manage IoT projects for Real-world case studies, which in turn helps them to apply the knowledge and skills acquired during the program.
modules: Modules Basic Sciences Computer Programming language Technical English skills Year 1 Holistic Education Engineering Graphics Technical Writing skills Introduction to sensors Data Structures and Algorithms Year 2 Database Management Systems Operating Systems , Programming Paradigm. Data Communication Networks Mini Project + Internships Introduction to IOT Advance IOT (IIOT, IOMT and BIOT) Year 3 IoT Analytics and security Wireless Networks Design and Analysis of Algorithms Project Work I & II + Internships Open Electives Data Mining and Warehousing Year 4 Concepts / Cryptography and Network Security/ BlockChain., etc) Program Electives(Mobile Application Development / Web Programming Knowledge based Learning System (Basics of AI)
career: Career prospects IoT developers design and create applications and solutions for connected devices, ensuring they can communicate and operate seamlessly within an IoT  ecosystem The IoT field creates a wide range of specialized roles, each with its own unique focus and responsibilities like, IoT Security Specialist, Data Analyst, IoT Quality Assurance, etc. Graduate with knowledge in core CSE and IOT specialization has vast horizon of career opportunities such as Software Developer/Engineer, Network Administrator/Engineer, Data Analyst/Scientist, Web Developer, System Administrator, Software Consultant, Project Manager, Business Analyst, User Experience (UX) Designer, AI and Machine Learning Engineer/ Architect, Research and Development (R&D) Centers System Design Engineer, Application Developer, and IOT Technology Architect. IoT infrastructure architect and IoT solutions engineer IoT systems administrator
